questions.explanation: The ability to drive safely is dependent on the driver being in good physical condition. Driving can be impaired by alcohol, legal and illegal drugs, and being drowsy.

questions.question: Night driving can be more difficult than driving during the day because:
questions.answerA: Cars overheat more quickly at night.
questions.answerB: Visibility is reduced in the dark.
questions.answerC: It is more likely to be raining at night.
questions.answerD: You are more likely to encounter a motorcycle at night.
questions.explanation: At night, your field of vision is reduced. To make sure you are able to react to hazards on the roadway, always use appropriate headlights. Drive slowly enough that you are able to stop within the distance that you can see ahead.

questions.question: What color are pavement markings that separate traffic lanes moving in opposite direction?
questions.answerA: Yellow
questions.answerB: White
questions.answerC: Yellow and white
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used in the center of the road to separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Railroad crossing.
questions.answerB: One-way traffic.
questions.answerC: Limited parking.
questions.explanation: Circular traffic signs indicate upcoming railroad crossings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a railroad crossing and should be looking for signs of an oncoming train.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: One-way traffic.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that drivers are about to encounter a divided highway.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Four-lane traffic ahead.
questions.answerB: Divided highway ahead.
questions.answerC: Two-way traffic ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns of two-way traffic ahead.

questions.question: The “No zone” is:
questions.answerA: A term used to describe blind spots around a truck or bus.
questions.answerB: A special speed zone.
questions.answerC: A roadway with restrictions on vehicle stereo volume.
questions.answerD: The television show that replaced The Twilight Zone.
questions.explanation: A truck or bus has blind spots on each side, in the rear, and in the front. An automobile cannot be seen in these blind spots. These blind spots are referred to as the “No zone.”

questions.question: If you want to get off the freeway but you have missed your exit, you should:
questions.answerA: Go to the next exit.
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn through the median.
questions.answerC: Pull onto the shoulder and back your car to the exit.
questions.answerD: Flag down a police officer for an escort back to your exit.
questions.explanation: If you miss your exit, you should take the next exit. Do not stop or back up on the highway, swerve across multiple lanes to try to make the exit at the last second, or cross over the median to turn around. All of these maneuvers are illegal and extremely dangerous.

questions.question: Lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions are divided by ____ lines.
questions.answerA: White
questions.answerB: Red
questions.answerC: Black
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to divide traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: You are driving up a hill and are approaching a heavy truck from the rear. You should know that:
questions.answerA: The truck may be traveling at a speed slower than the posted speed limit.
questions.answerB: You may not be able to safely pass the truck.
questions.answerC: You may not be able to legally pass the truck.
questions.explanation: Drivers must be aware that large vehicles often travel at a speed slower than the posted speed limit, especially when driving on an incline, and should use caution when approaching a large vehicle from the rear. When on a hill with limited visibility, it is unlawful to pass another vehicle.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: U-turns are prohibited.
questions.answerB: U-turns are permitted.
questions.answerC: Winding road ahead.
questions.explanation: A regulatory sign displaying a red circle with a red slash through the middle indicates that a specific action is prohibited. U-turns are not permitted where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Anything that requires you to ____ could cause you to crash.
questions.answerA: Take your eyes off the road
questions.answerB: Take your hands off the wheel
questions.answerC: Take your attention away from the task of driving
questions.explanation: Anything that causes you to take your attention away from driving, take your eyes off the road, and/or take your hands off the wheel is a distraction.

questions.question: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes:
questions.answerA: In curves and on hills.
questions.answerB: Next to churches and schools.
questions.answerC: At intersections and pedestrian crosswalks.
questions.explanation: Stop lines are solid white lines painted across traffic lanes at intersections and pedestrian crosswalks. They indicate the exact location at which approaching drivers must stop.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.answerA: Intersection.
questions.answerB: Road curve.
questions.answerC: Right turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that an intersection with a crossing road is ahead.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: Signal at least 100 feet before changing lanes to pass and ensure there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: Use your mirrors and look over your left shoulder to check your blind spot when passing to the left.
questions.answerC: When passing, wait until you can see both headlights of the passed car in your rearview mirror before returning to your original lane.
questions.explanation: When passing, you must always signal at least 100 feet in advance of your lane change. Always check behind you in your mirrors and look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. Wait until you can see both headlights of the passed car in your rearview mirror before returning to your original lane.

questions.question: When driving on roads that may be slippery:
questions.answerA: Always drive at the maximum speed limit.
questions.answerB: Use cruise control to maintain a steady speed.
questions.answerC: Reduce your following distance.
questions.answerD: Do not make any sudden changes in speed or direction.
questions.explanation: You should avoid making any sudden changes in speed or direction when driving on a slippery surface. Reduce your speed on slippery roads and do not use cruise control.

questions.question: Your vehicle's stopping distance increases when stopping:
questions.answerA: On a wet or icy road.
questions.answerB: On paved highways.
questions.answerC: When driving at night.
questions.explanation: Stopping distances increase on wet or icy roads. Stopping distances also increase on road surfaces covered in loose gravel or stones.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Roundabout ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane ends, merge left.
questions.answerC: Turn around.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a roundabout is ahead. Enter a roundabout at a low speed and yield to existing traffic.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Do not pass.
questions.answerB: Do not enter.
questions.answerC: No turn on red.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. The road will split into two one-way roadways separated by a median or divider. You must keep to the right.

questions.question: Work zone signs mean:
questions.answerA: It is summer.
questions.answerB: You must immediately stop and back up.
questions.answerC: Less than ideal conditions are present for driving.
questions.answerD: You should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
questions.explanation: Work zone signs are orange and indicate that some type of work is being performed on or alongside the roadway. Be extremely careful when you see these signs.

questions.question: At dusk or on overcast days, you should:
questions.answerA: Drive using your four-way flashers.
questions.answerB: Drive using your parking lights.
questions.answerC: Not turn on any vehicle lights.
questions.explanation: At dusk or on overcast days, you must turn on your headlights. Dim your lights to their low beam setting when within 1,000 feet of an approaching vehicle and when within 500 feet of a vehicle that you are following. When driving in poor weather, always use your low beams.

questions.question: You may not park:
questions.answerA: On a hill.
questions.answerB: In a parking lot.
questions.answerC: On a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane.
questions.answerD: Within 12 inches of the right side of the road.
questions.explanation: There are a number of locations where it is unlawful to park, including on a crosswalk or in a marked bicycle lane. When parking on the street, you must be within 12 inches of the side of the road.

questions.question: When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Increase their speed to reach their final destination more quickly.
questions.answerB: Decrease their following distance.
questions.answerC: Increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: When driving on wet roads, drivers should increase their following distance.

questions.question: What should you do if your accelerator sticks while you are driving?
questions.answerA: Reach down and attempt to pull it up.
questions.answerB: Shift to park.
questions.answerC: Shift to neutral and apply steady pressure on the brake.
questions.explanation: If your accelerator sticks while you are driving, keep your eyes on the road. Quickly shift the vehicle into neutral and apply steady pressure on the brake pedal. Pull off the road when it is safe to do so and turn off the engine.

questions.question: Drivers must yield to a pedestrian:
questions.answerA: Even if the pedestrian crosses the street carelessly.
questions.answerB: Only when the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
questions.answerC: Only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road as the driver.
questions.answerD: If the pedestrian uses a hand signal to ask oncoming drivers to stop.
questions.explanation: Drivers must always yield to pedestrians in the street, even if they are crossing against a red light or are otherwise being careless.

questions.question: You must keep proof of your liability insurance:
questions.answerA: At your place of employment.
questions.answerB: In a safety deposit box at the bank.
questions.answerC: In your vehicle whenever it is being operated.
questions.explanation: State law requires all motor vehicle operators and owners to have a form of liability insurance. You must keep proof of insurance in your vehicle. If a law enforcement officer asks you for proof and you cannot show it, you will receive a ticket.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No U-turn.
questions.answerB: No turning.
questions.answerC: No left turn.
questions.explanation: This sign prohibits U-turns. Do not make a U-turn where this sign is posted.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to an open intersection:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: If you arrive to an open intersection at the same time as a vehicle to your right, you should yield the right-of-way to that vehicle. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: A left curve is ahead.
questions.answerB: A series of curves is ahead.
questions.answerC: An S-curve is ahead.
questions.answerD: The road will be slippery when wet.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that especially slippery conditions exist when the road is wet.

questions.question: SATOP is an abbreviation for:
questions.answerA: Substance Abuse Traffic Offender Program.
questions.answerB: Salt And Tar On Pavement.
questions.answerC: Steer At The Other Point.
questions.explanation: SATOP is an abbreviation for Substance Abuse Traffic Offender Program. Completing this program is a requirement of those convicted of alcohol-related driving offenses.

questions.question: This sign is used to warn drivers about:
questions.answerA: Upcoming intersections.
questions.answerB: Road construction.
questions.answerC: An upcoming curve in the road.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead curves to the right.

questions.question: When you want to make a right turn, your car must be:
questions.answerA: Near the center of the street.
questions.answerB: Close to the left side of the street.
questions.answerC: Close to the right side of the street.
questions.answerD: Past the center of the intersection when you begin to turn.
questions.explanation: As you prepare to make a right turn, you should get as far to the right side of the road as possible. Do not cut across lanes of traffic to perform any turn.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Hunting area.
questions.answerB: State park.
questions.answerC: Deer crossing.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that deer cross the roadway in the area. You should slow down, be alert, and be ready to stop.

questions.question: When approaching a traffic signal displaying a steady green arrow, drivers:
questions.answerA: Should merge into a lane in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerB: Should slow to a stop, if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: May turn in the direction of the arrow after yielding to traffic and pedestrians already in the intersection.
questions.answerD: May drive straight through the intersection.
questions.explanation: A green arrow displayed on a traffic signal tells drivers that they may turn in the direction of the arrow. You must be in the proper lane for such a turn. Yield the right-of-way to vehicles and pedestrians already in the intersection.

questions.question: A double solid yellow line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines are used to separate traffic moving in opposite directions. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: When you drive through an area where children are playing, you should expect them:
questions.answerA: To know when it is safe to cross the street.
questions.answerB: To stop at the curb before crossing the street.
questions.answerC: To run out in front of you without looking.
questions.answerD: Not to cross the street unless they are with an adult.
questions.explanation: You should always reduce your speed and use extra caution when children are in the vicinity. They may fail to understand the danger and may run out in front of you without looking.

questions.question: What does a single dashed yellow line separating traffic mean?
questions.answerA: Drivers may pass if it is safe to do so.
questions.answerB: Both lanes travel in the same direction.
questions.answerC: Drivers may not pass.
questions.answerD: Drivers may pass, even if it could be dangerous.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines separate traffic moving in opposite directions. A single dashed yellow line in the center of a road indicates that vehicles traveling in both directions are permitted to pass. Drivers may only begin a pass if they will not interfere with any oncoming traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: It is okay for drivers of other vehicles to follow motorcycles closely.
questions.answerB: A motorcycle with two people on it is more balanced than a motorcycle with just one rider.
questions.answerC: The driver of a passenger vehicle must change lanes completely when passing a motorcycle.
questions.answerD: Drivers of other vehicles can expect a motorcycle's brake lights to turn on when the motorcyclist slows down.
questions.explanation: Motorcycles are entitled to the width of a full lane. Be sure your vehicle is entirely in the left lane before attempting to pass a motorcycle on the left.

questions.question: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you:
questions.answerA: May still turn, but you must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.answerB: May no longer turn and must proceed straight.
questions.answerC: Still have the right-of-way to turn.
questions.answerD: No longer have to turn in the direction that the arrow indicated.
questions.explanation: If a green arrow turns into a solid green light, you may still turn in the direction that the arrow was pointing but you must first yield to pedestrians and oncoming traffic.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop ahead.
questions.answerB: Buggy warning.
questions.answerC: Limited parking.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that there is an upcoming stop sign and that they should prepare to come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: If you are at fault in a traffic crash and do not pay for the damages:
questions.answerA: Your driver license and/or plates will be suspended for one year.
questions.answerB: You will save money.
questions.answerC: Your car will be repossessed.
questions.answerD: You must buy a new car.
questions.explanation: If you are at fault in an accident and do not pay for the damages you caused, your driver license and/or vehicle license plates will be suspended for one year. You may have your license and plates reinstated during that one-year period if you pay a fee and provide proof that you have settled damages.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: All traffic must turn left.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: No U-turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that left turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop.
questions.answerB: Side road.
questions.answerC: Two-way left turn.
questions.explanation: Eight-sided traffic signs warn drivers that they must stop and yield the appropriate right-of-way at an intersection. Drivers may proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: What should you do when an emergency vehicle is approaching while displaying flashing red or blue lights?
questions.answerA: See if you can reach your destination before the emergency vehicle catches up to you.
questions.answerB: Continue driving but try to stay out of its way.
questions.answerC: Pull over to the side of the road and come to a complete stop.
questions.answerD: Stop in the middle of an intersection.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to all emergency vehicles using a siren, air horn, and/or flashing red, blue, or white lights. Where possible, you must pull over to the right edge of the road. If you are in an intersection, drive through the intersection before you pull over.

questions.question: You are driving on a divided multilane highway and see or hear the signal of an approaching emergency vehicle. You should:
questions.answerA: Disregard the signal if there are other lanes available for the emergency vehicle.
questions.answerB: Stop as quickly as you can.
questions.answerC: Slow down, move your vehicle to provide a clear path for the emergency vehicle, and stop.
questions.answerD: Increase your speed to get out of the way of the emergency vehicle.
questions.explanation: If you hear the siren or see the flashing lights of an emergency vehicle, you must slow down, provide a clear path for the vehicle, and stop. Don't try to outdrive the emergency vehicle.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Parking spaces are reserved for people with disabled parking permits.
questions.answerB: A circular intersection is ahead.
questions.answerC: Traffic in the lane must turn in the direction of the arrow.
questions.answerD: Lanes are reserved for buses and vehicles with a driver and one or more passengers.
questions.explanation: This sign marks parking spaces that are reserved for people with disabled parking permits.

questions.question: A flashing red light on a traffic signal means:
questions.answerA: The same thing as a stop sign.
questions.answerB: The traffic signal is broken.
questions.answerC: You do not have to come to a complete stop.
questions.explanation: A flashing red light means the same thing as a stop sign. If you encounter a flashing red light, you should come to a complete stop, yield to appropriate traffic and pedestrians, and only proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: You must yield to other drivers:
questions.answerA: When entering a street from a garage or alley.
questions.answerB: When they are on a road to your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
questions.answerC: When your traffic signal is a green arrow.
questions.explanation: You must yield to other drivers when entering a street from an alley, driveway, or garage. You must also yield to pedestrians who are on an intersecting sidewalk.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Stop sign ahead.
questions.answerB: Lane closed ahead.
questions.answerC: Railroad crossing ahead.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This warning sign indicates that a traffic signal is ahead and drivers should prepare to react to a yellow or red light.

questions.question: Which of the following is true regarding seat belts and child restraints in vehicles?
questions.answerA: You should never place an infant or small child in the front seat of a vehicle with airbags.
questions.answerB: An airbag can be dangerous to an infant or small child, even in a low-speed collision.
questions.answerC: You should always make sure all your passengers are using a seat belt or child restraint.
questions.explanation: Before you drive, always fasten your seat belt and make sure all your passengers are using seat belts or child restraints. Studies have shown that if you use seat belts, your chances of being hurt or killed in a traffic crash are greatly reduced. Children age 12 and under should always ride properly restrained in a rear seat. Never put a rear-facing infant restraint in the front seat of a vehicle with a front passenger airbag.

questions.question: A solid white line on the right edge of the highway slants in to the left. That shows that:
questions.answerA: There is an intersection just ahead.
questions.answerB: You are approaching a construction area.
questions.answerC: You will be required to turn left just ahead.
questions.explanation: A solid line along the side of the road indicates where its edge is, marking the boundary between the travel lane and the shoulder. If the edge line angles toward the center of the road, this means that the road is narrower ahead.

questions.question: A regulatory sign containing a red circle with a slash through the middle indicates:
questions.answerA: That drivers should come to a complete stop.
questions.answerB: That an action is forbidden.
questions.answerC: That some drivers should yield to other drivers.
questions.answerD: That drivers should drive under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Some regulatory signs prohibit certain actions. These signs are rectangular and white with red and black markings. A red circle and slash on top of a black symbol indicates that the specified action is forbidden.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way.
questions.answerB: School crossing ahead.
questions.answerC: Do not drive in this lane.
questions.answerD: Traffic turning left on the green light must yield to oncoming traffic.
questions.explanation: This sign is used with a traffic signal to tell drivers that left-turning traffic does not have the right-of-way and must instead wait for oncoming traffic to clear.

questions.question: A driver entering public traffic from a driveway or private road:
questions.answerA: Has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: Should yield to drivers already on the public road.
questions.answerC: May force their way into traffic.
questions.answerD: Can assume that other drivers will change lanes to make room.
questions.explanation: If you are entering traffic from a driveway or private road, you should yield to drivers already on the public road. Merge safely into traffic when you are able to do so.

questions.question: A red traffic signal light means that you must:
questions.answerA: Stop at the stop line.
questions.answerB: Stop before entering any crosswalk.
questions.answerC: Stop before entering the intersection.
questions.explanation: A red traffic light means that you must stop before entering the intersection. You must at any stop line and before entering any crosswalk.

questions.question: A driver entering interstate traffic from an entrance or acceleration ramp:
questions.answerA: Should yield to drivers already on the interstate.
questions.answerB: Has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: May force their way into traffic.
questions.answerD: Can assume that other drivers will change lanes to make room.
questions.explanation: If you are on an entrance or acceleration ramp and are entering interstate traffic, you should yield to drivers already on the interstate highway. Merge safely into traffic when you are able to do so.

questions.question: When entering a street from a driveway, you:
questions.answerA: Must drive slowly to allow approaching vehicles and pedestrians time to get out of your way.
questions.answerB: Must honk your horn so approaching vehicles and pedestrians know to give you room.
questions.answerC: Must stop and proceed only when there are no pedestrians or vehicles approaching.
questions.answerD: Can disregard any pedestrians if there is no sidewalk.
questions.explanation: Always stop before entering the roadway from a driveway and yield to any approaching vehicles or crossing pedestrians. The stop should be made before crossing the sidewalk area. Failure to stop is unlawful.

questions.question: You want to turn left at an intersection. The light is green but oncoming traffic is heavy. You should:
questions.answerA: Use the next intersection.
questions.answerB: Wait at the crosswalk for traffic to clear.
questions.answerC: Wait in the center of the intersection for traffic to clear.
questions.answerD: Take the right-of-way since you have a green light.
questions.explanation: When making a left turn where there is approaching traffic, you must wait for the approaching traffic to go through before you turn. You may enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green and no other vehicle ahead of you plans to make a left turn.

questions.question: The correct way to use a freeway exit ramp is to:
questions.answerA: Slow down before entering the exit ramp.
questions.answerB: Slow down once moving onto the exit ramp.
questions.answerC: Keep your speed constant once in the exit ramp.
questions.answerD: Pass slower traffic in the exit ramp.
questions.explanation: When using a freeway exit ramp, do not slow down until you move onto the exit ramp.

questions.question: If you are driving on the interstate and pass your exit, you should:
questions.answerA: Quickly cut across traffic to make your turn.
questions.answerB: Make a U-turn to go back to the exit.
questions.answerC: Continue driving and use the next exit.
questions.answerD: Put your vehicle in reverse to go back to the exit.
questions.explanation: Don’t make a last-minute turn into an exit. If you pass your exit, you must go to the next one.

questions.question: Alcohol:
questions.answerA: Slows reflexes and reaction time.
questions.answerB: Puts you to sleep.
questions.answerC: Wakes you up.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant drug that slows the activity of the brain and reduces the skills that you need for safe driving. Drinking alcohol results in slowed reaction time and impaired judgment.

questions.question: A stop sign is shaped like a(n):
questions.answerA: Rectangle.
questions.answerB: Square.
questions.answerC: Circle.
questions.explanation: An octagonal shape is used only for stop signs. All eight-sided signs tell drivers to come to a complete stop before proceeding.

questions.question: When parking your vehicle downhill on a two-way street:
questions.answerA: Turn your wheels to the right.
questions.answerB: Turn your wheels to the left.
questions.answerC: Keep your wheels pointed straight ahead.
questions.explanation: When you park on a downward-facing slope, turn your wheels sharply toward the side of the road. This way, if your vehicle starts to roll downhill, it will roll away from traffic.

questions.question: In Missouri, it is illegal for an adult driver to operate a motor vehicle with a minimum blood alcohol concentration (BAC) of:
questions.answerA: 0.08 percent.
questions.answerB: 0.05 percent.
questions.answerC: 0.02 percent.
questions.explanation: In Missouri, it is illegal for a driver age 21 or older to operate a motor vehicle with a BAC of 0.08 percent or more. It is illegal for a driver under the age of 21 to operate a motor vehicle with a BAC of 0.02 percent or more. Being convicted of Driving While Intoxicated (DWI) may result license suspension or revocation.

questions.question: As alcohol builds up in your blood, it:
questions.answerA: Slows down your reactions.
questions.answerB: Makes you feel less confident.
questions.answerC: Begins to metabolize itself more quickly.
questions.answerD: Decreases the number of driving errors.
questions.explanation: As alcohol builds up in your system, it will slow your reactions, make you feel more confident, and cause you to make more errors.

questions.question: If you are driving in another driver's blind spot, you should:
questions.answerA: Move forward or drop back so the other driver can see you.
questions.answerB: Keep a steady pace.
questions.answerC: Stay in the driver's blind spot.
questions.answerD: Honk to let them know you are there.
questions.explanation: Do not drive in someone else’s blind spot. Move forward or drop back so that the other driver can see you.

questions.question: This sign is a:
questions.answerA: Service sign.
questions.answerB: Regulatory sign.
questions.answerC: Warning sign.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped and yellow with black lettering or symbols. They warn drivers about special situations or potential hazards ahead.

questions.question: When changing lanes you should not:
questions.answerA: Check your side and rearview mirrors.
questions.answerB: Give a turn signal to signal your intentions.
questions.answerC: Check for other drivers who may be moving into the same lane as you.
questions.answerD: Use your cell phone to contact the police to determine if the road ahead is clear.
questions.explanation: Before changing lanes, check your side and rearview mirrors for traffic approaching you from behind. Use your turn signal to let other drivers know you plan to change lanes. Check for other drivers who also may be moving into the same lane.

questions.question: A point accumulation advisory letter will be sent to you if you:
questions.answerA: Have too many points taken off of your driving record.
questions.answerB: Accumulate a total of four points in 12 months.
questions.answerC: Do not score enough points on your driving test.
questions.explanation: If you accumulate a total of four points within 12 months, you will be sent a point accumulation advisory letter. If you accumulate a total of eight or more points within 18 months, your driving privileges will be suspended.

questions.question: Drinking alcohol and driving is:
questions.answerA: A minor traffic safety problem.
questions.answerB: A serious traffic safety problem.
questions.answerC: Safe if you have only had a few drinks.
questions.answerD: Only dangerous to the driver who drinks.
questions.explanation: Driving while impaired or intoxicated is a serious traffic safety problem. Safe driving is not possible when you drink alcohol or take other drugs. Driving under the influence is dangerous both to you and to others on the road.

questions.question: Worn or bald tires:
questions.answerA: Can make turning more difficult.
questions.answerB: Are likely to hydroplane.
questions.answerC: Can increase your stopping distance.
questions.explanation: Worn or bald tires can increase your stopping distance and make turning more difficult. Tires without adequate tread also increase the risk of hydroplaning.

questions.question: A steady yellow signal light means:
questions.answerA: The traffic signal is changing from green to red.
questions.answerB: You should slam on your brakes.
questions.answerC: You should increase your speed.
questions.answerD: The car in front of you is going too slowly.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow light tells you the traffic signal is changing from green to red. Slow down and stop for a steady yellow light, unless you are already within the intersection or cannot safely stop before entering the intersection.

questions.question: The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
questions.answerA: Speed up to increase the distance between you and the tailgater.
questions.answerB: Slam on your brakes to get the other driver to back off.
questions.answerC: Change lanes or gradually slow down to encourage them to pass.
questions.explanation: Check the traffic behind you several times a minute to know if another driver is tailgating, approaching too fast, or trying to pass. If another car is following you too closely, slow down and let it pass. Most rear-end collisions are caused by vehicles following too closely.

questions.question: You are driving when it begins to rain. You should:
questions.answerA: Drive faster than surrounding traffic.
questions.answerB: Drive at the maximum posted speed limit.
questions.answerC: Slow down.
questions.answerD: Drive closely behind the vehicle in front of you.
questions.explanation: When heavy rain reduces visibility, reduce your speed. Turn on your headlights so other drivers can see your vehicle. If the rain is so heavy that you are unable to see clearly, drive onto the shoulder and stop until the rain lets up.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about railroad crossings is true?
questions.answerA: It is against the law to go around lowered gates at a crossing.
questions.answerB: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger.
questions.answerC: Not all railroad crossings are equipped with flashing red signals and gates.
questions.explanation: You must stop at a railroad crossing when directed to do so by a flagger, stop sign, or warning devices, such as gates or flashing lights. Not all railroad crossings are equipped with such devices. It is against the law to drive around lowered railroad crossing gates.

questions.question: If you are driving near a motorcycle, you must:
questions.answerA: Allow the motorcycle to use a complete lane.
questions.answerB: Drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
questions.answerC: Allow the motorcycle to use only half of a lane.
questions.answerD: Pass using the same lane as the motorcycle.
questions.explanation: A motorcycle is a full-size vehicle with the same privileges as any other vehicle on the roadway. You should allow a motorcyclist a full lane width. Although it may seem as though there is enough room in the traffic lane for a larger vehicle and a motorcycle, remember that the motorcycle needs room to maneuver safely.

questions.question: How can you lower the risk of hydroplaning?
questions.answerA: Do not speed when the roads are wet.
questions.answerB: Use tires with proper air pressure.
questions.answerC: Replace tires with bad tread.
questions.explanation: Hydroplaning happens when a vehicle glides on top of a thin layer of water between its tires and the road. Tires with low air pressure or bad tread can increase the risk of hydroplaning. Speeding also increases the risk.

questions.question: The most effective safety restraints in a traffic crash are:
questions.answerA: Only a lap and shoulder belt.
questions.answerB: Only an airbag.
questions.answerC: Both a lap/shoulder belt and an airbag.
questions.explanation: Safety belts can double your chance of surviving a crash and more than double your chance of avoiding serious injury. Airbags, when used properly with safety belts, provide additional protection in a front-end crash. You should wear both shoulder and lap belts.

questions.question: The risk of hydroplaning can can be reduced by driving:
questions.answerA: Through shallow water.
questions.answerB: More quickly.
questions.answerC: More slowly.
questions.explanation: Because hydroplaning is caused by driving too quickly in wet conditions, the risk of it happening can be reduced by driving more slowly.

questions.question: Front door windows on a vehicle may be tinted to no more than:
questions.answerA: 100 percent light blockage.
questions.answerB: Whatever looks good.
questions.answerC: 65 percent light blockage.
questions.explanation: Tinting or sun-screening material is permitted on side and rear windows. Front door windows may be tinted to no more than 65 percent light blockage.

questions.question: A solid white line down the center of a two-lane road indicates:
questions.answerA: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerB: Lanes are moving in opposite directions and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.answerC: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are not permitted to pass.
questions.answerD: Lanes are moving in the same direction and drivers are permitted to pass when it is safe to do so.
questions.explanation: White lines are used to separate traffic moving in the same direction. Solid lines indicate that drivers are not permitted to pass.

questions.question: When approached by an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and/or flashing lights, a driver must immediately:
questions.answerA: Pull to the right and stop.
questions.answerB: Pull to the right and slow down.
questions.answerC: Pull to the right and turn on their vehicle's four-way flashers.
questions.answerD: Stop and let the emergency vehicle pass.
questions.explanation: When you are approached by an emergency vehicle that is using its lights, sirens, and/or other warning devices, you must immediately drive to the right side of the road and stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Road construction ahead.
questions.answerB: The road ahead curves left, then right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead curves right, then left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead curves to the right and then to the left. You should slow down to be able to negotiate these curves safely.

questions.question: Hydroplaning is usually caused by:
questions.answerA: Excessive stops.
questions.answerB: Sudden stops.
questions.answerC: Sudden turns.
questions.explanation: Your tires become less effective at clearing water from the road as you increase your speed. If you drive too fast, they may lose their grip entirely, leaving the vehicle sliding on a film of water. This is known as "hydroplaning."

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: School ahead.
questions.answerB: School crossing.
questions.answerC: Pedestrian crossing.
questions.answerD: Construction workers on or near the roadway.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are usually diamond-shaped with black markings on a yellow background. They alert drivers to upcoming hazards. This sign indicates that there may be pedestrians crossing the road ahead.

questions.question: When making a right or left turn, a driver should signal ____ in advance of the turn.
questions.answerA: 100 feet
questions.answerB: 50 feet
questions.answerC: 35 feet
questions.explanation: Before you change lanes or make a turn, let other drivers know what you are going to do by signaling. You can signal with your hand and arm or with your vehicle’s turn signals and brake lights. You should signal at least 100 feet before you change lanes or turn so the other drivers can be ready to react to your movements.

questions.question: You are driving when it starts to sleet or snow. You should:
questions.answerA: Keep your windshield and mirrors clear.
questions.answerB: Allow additional distance between your vehicle and the vehicles that you are following.
questions.answerC: Approach all vehicles with caution.
questions.explanation: In snowy weather, keep your windshield and mirrors clear. Increase your following distance when driving in wet and cold weather because a slippery road surface will increase the distance needed for your vehicle to stop.

questions.question: When driving in fog, you should use your:
questions.answerA: Low beam headlights.
questions.answerB: High beam headlights.
questions.answerC: Parking lights.
questions.explanation: If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, as well as your fog lights, if your vehicle has them. High beams direct their light upwards, where it can bounce off the fog and into your eyes, reducing visibility even more.

questions.question: Your ability to stop is affected by:
questions.answerA: Signal lights.
questions.answerB: Other cars on the road.
questions.answerC: The time of day.
questions.explanation: Your ability to stop is greatly affected by the condition of the road. You need to reduce your speed when road conditions are poor in order to maintain control of your vehicle. You will be at risk if you are driving too quickly on roads that are slippery and you need to stop.

questions.question: If two drivers arrive at the same time to a four-way intersection controlled by stop signs:
questions.answerA: The driver on the right has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The driver on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: One driver may continue driving without stopping.
questions.answerD: One driver should honk to indicate that they are giving up the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: Yield the right-of-way to the driver on your right at a four-way intersection if you both arrive to the intersection at the same time. You may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: A flashing red traffic signal at an intersection has the same requirements as:
questions.answerA: A slow sign.
questions.answerB: A yield sign.
questions.answerC: A stop sign.
questions.explanation: When approaching a flashing red signal, you must stop and yield to all traffic that does not have to stop.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: One-way road.
questions.answerB: No right turn.
questions.answerC: Exit.
questions.answerD: Sharp right turn in the road ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that there is a sharp right turn ahead.

questions.question: You are driving when your power steering stops working. You should:
questions.answerA: Honk your horn and turn off the ignition.
questions.answerB: Turn on your hazard lights and brace yourself.
questions.answerC: Work hard to steer, reduce your speed, drive to a safe area, and stop.
questions.explanation: If your power steering stops working, additional effort will be required to maintain steering control. Reduce your speed and pull off the roadway to stop in a safe area.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must drive slowly and sound your horn.
questions.answerB: A bus stop is ahead.
questions.answerC: You are entering a school's parking lot.
questions.explanation: Warning signs are used to warn drivers about upcoming hazardous conditions and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign tells drivers that they are approaching a school zone and that they should slow down and watch for children.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Watch for bicycles.
questions.answerB: Bicycles not allowed.
questions.answerC: Bicycle repair shop ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign provides advance warning that bicycles may be present.

questions.question: When approaching an accident scene, you should:
questions.answerA: Keep your attention on your driving.
questions.answerB: Keep moving.
questions.answerC: Stop if you are involved or if emergency help has not yet arrived.
questions.explanation: Do not stop at an accident scene unless you are involved or emergency help has not yet arrived. Keep your attention on your driving and keep moving, watching for people who might be on or near the road. Never drive to the scene of an accident, fire, or other disaster just to look.

questions.question: If two vehicles arrive to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time:
questions.answerA: The largest vehicle has the right-of-way.
questions.answerB: The car on the left has the right-of-way.
questions.answerC: The car on the left shall yield to the car on the right.
questions.answerD: The car on the right shall yield to the car on the left.
questions.explanation: If two vehicles arrive at the same time to an uncontrolled intersection, the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right. The driver on the left may then proceed when it is safe to do so.

questions.question: Shortly before your driver or nondriver license expires, the Driver License Bureau will mail a renewal reminder postcard to:
questions.answerA: The most current address on your driver record.
questions.answerB: The address on your last application.
questions.answerC: The address in your local phone book.
questions.explanation: The department will mail you a reminder to renew before your license expires. The reminder will be sent to the mailing address on your driver record. A renewal notice will not be mailed for a temporary instruction permit or commercial learner’s permit.

questions.question: Defensive driving is:
questions.answerA: Identifying dangerous driving situations and taking action to avoid accidents.
questions.answerB: Defending yourself against poor drivers by getting ahead of them in traffic.
questions.answerC: Following the vehicle ahead of you at a close distance.
questions.answerD: Quickly changing lanes and shifting in and out of traffic congestion.
questions.explanation: You drive defensively when you identify dangerous driving situations and take action before an accident occurs. Defensive driving helps prevent conflicts with aggressive, offensive, discourteous, careless, inattentive, impulsive, ignorant, or intoxicated drivers or pedestrians.

questions.question: To avoid being in a truck or bus driver’s blind spot, you should:
questions.answerA: Never pass them.
questions.answerB: Avoid driving alongside them and avoid tailgating.
questions.answerC: Flash your lights at them.
questions.explanation: Because a large vehicle, such as a truck or bus, has large blind spots to its sides and rear, avoid driving alongside such a vehicle and do not tailgate one.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: No left turn.
questions.answerB: No U-turns.
questions.answerC: No exit.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited.

questions.question: This is a ____ sign.
questions.answerA: Stop
questions.answerB: Wrong way
questions.answerC: Yield
questions.explanation: This triangular sign is a "Yield" sign. When you see this sign, you must slow down to check for traffic and yield the right-of-way to pedestrians and approaching cross traffic. Stop only if it is necessary to do so.

questions.question: Two solid yellow lines on the pavement mean:
questions.answerA: Passing is allowed for drivers from both directions.
questions.answerB: Passing is not allowed.
questions.answerC: Passing is allowed if you are at the top a hill.
questions.answerD: Passing is allowed during daylight only.
questions.explanation: Yellow lines tell you that the traffic on the other side of the lines is moving in the opposite direction. You should never cross two solid yellow lines to pass from either direction.

questions.question: A license plate frame:
questions.answerA: May cover the word "Missouri" on the plate.
questions.answerB: Should not cover any information on the plate.
questions.answerC: May cover the month and year registration stickers.
questions.answerD: May cover the wording at the bottom of the plate.
questions.explanation: Missouri law requires that license plates be securely fastened to a vehicle and that all parts of the plates are visible and clean for view or inspection by any law enforcement entity. If you have frames around your license plates, the Missouri State Highway Patrol requires that the frames do not cover any part of the plates.

questions.question: FACT is an abbreviation for:
questions.answerA: Finance A Car Today.
questions.answerB: Full Ambulance Cannot Turn.
questions.answerC: Fear of Authority Causes Tension.
questions.answerD: Failure to Appear in Court for Traffic violations.
questions.explanation: FACT is an abbreviation for "Failure to Appear in Court for Traffic violations." When you fail to appear in court for a traffic violation, the court will notify you within 10 days of your failure to comply. Failure to comply will result in suspension of your license.

questions.question: The youngest age a person may be to obtain an instruction permit is:
questions.answerA: 14 years old.
questions.answerB: 15 years old.
questions.answerC: 15 and one-half years old.
questions.explanation: Young drivers are eligible for an instruction permit at the age of 15. This permit allows a young person to learn to drive with the supervision of a licensed adult.

questions.question: A driver who is taking a non-prescription drug should:
questions.answerA: Read the labels on the drug before driving.
questions.answerB: Drink alcohol instead.
questions.answerC: Continue to drive regardless of any warning labels.
questions.explanation: Many over-the-counter medications can affect your ability to drive safely. If you take medication, even a remedy for colds or allergies that is not prescribed, check the label for warnings about its effects. If you are unsure, ask your doctor or pharmacist about driving while on the medication.

questions.question: You may pass another vehicle:
questions.answerA: In a curve or on a hill because the chance is small that another vehicle is coming.
questions.answerB: By using the shoulder of the highway.
questions.answerC: If your lane is next to a solid yellow line and the passing lane is clear ahead.
questions.explanation: You may not pass another vehicle on a hill or in a curve because you cannot see oncoming traffic and may cause a collision. Never pass another vehicle by driving onto the shoulder of a highway. Passing another vehicle by driving over a solid yellow line is prohibited.

questions.question: When preparing to turn left, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Slow down gradually while checking their rearview mirror.
questions.answerB: Move into the left lane.
questions.answerC: Watch for oncoming vehicles and pedestrians.
questions.explanation: As you approach a left turn, signal your intentions three to five seconds in advance. Continually check your rearview mirror as you gradually slow down. On a multilane road, move into the left lane before reaching the intersection where you plan to turn. Yield to traffic and pedestrians and turn when your path is clear.

questions.question: Lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are divided by ____ lines.
questions.answerA: Yellow
questions.answerB: White
questions.answerC: Red
questions.explanation: Solid white lines are used to separate lanes traveling in the same direction (as well as to mark the right edge of the road). Broken white lines separate lanes traveling in the same direction and may be crossed to pass. Yellow lines separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.

questions.question: A yellow light that flashes on and off means:
questions.answerA: Stop and look for other vehicles, then go if there is no traffic.
questions.answerB: Stop and wait for a green light.
questions.answerC: Speed up to clear the intersection quickly.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow traffic light means drivers should slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: If you are convicted of Driving While Intoxicated (DWI) for the second time in a five-year period, you will:
questions.answerA: Lose your license for only 90 days.
questions.answerB: Be restricted to drivng on residential roadways.
questions.answerC: Be required to install an Ignition Interlock Device (IID).
questions.answerD: Be required to drive 10 mph under the speed limit at all times.
questions.explanation: When convicted of a DWI, a driver who is above the age of 21 faces both administrative and court-convicted consequences. A second conviction within a five-year period may result in license suspension for one year, license denial for five years, a fee of $1,000, and/or up to one year of jail time. A second conviction will require an IID to be installed before a license can be reinstated.

questions.question: When encountering an aggressive driver, you should:
questions.answerA: Avoid eye contact, slow down, and let them pass.
questions.answerB: Cut them off to slow them down.
questions.answerC: Retaliate by tailgating them.
questions.answerD: Make sure they know you disapprove of their behavior.
questions.explanation: If another driver is threatening you or intentionally driving dangerously around you, remain calm and try to put as much distance between the two of you as possible. Slow down and let them pass. Do not make eye contact and do not make obscene gestures.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Pedestrians only.
questions.answerB: Intersection ahead.
questions.answerC: Hiking trails ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a school crossing is ahead.

questions.question: A solid yellow line on your side of the centerline means:
questions.answerA: Slow down.
questions.answerB: Pass with caution.
questions.answerC: Do not pass.
questions.explanation: A solid yellow line next to your lane means that passing is not permitted from your direction.

questions.question: You must stop at an intersection when you see a:
questions.answerA: Flashing red light.
questions.answerB: Steady yellow light.
questions.answerC: Yellow arrow.
questions.explanation: A flashing red traffic signal has the same meaning as a stop sign. At an intersection with a flashing red light, you must come to a complete stop, look both ways, and proceed only after the intersection is clear.

questions.question: When approaching a railroad crossing, you should:
questions.answerA: Slow down.
questions.answerB: Look for a train.
questions.answerC: Be ready to stop.
questions.explanation: When you see any signs indicating a nearby railroad crossing, you should slow down, look for a train, and be ready to stop. If the red warning lights are flashing or the gate is down, you must stop 15 to 50 feet before the railroad tracks. Do not try to go around the gate.

questions.question: The consumption of alcohol while taking drugs can:
questions.answerA: Decrease the effects of the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerB: Increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol.
questions.answerC: Help cure your illness.
questions.explanation: The combination of alcohol and drugs, in some cases, can increase the effects of both the drugs and alcohol. It can be unsafe to drive after consuming either alcohol or drugs and is even more dangerous after combining them.

questions.question: Which of the following is a safe way to drive through a curve?
questions.answerA: Slow down as you enter, speed up as you exit.
questions.answerB: Maintain a constant speed throughout the curve.
questions.answerC: Speed up as you enter, slow down as you exit.
questions.answerD: Stay near the right edge of your lane.
questions.explanation: You should slow down as you enter a curve and increase your speed gradually as you exit. Increasing your speed as you enter a curve will make it more difficult to control your vehicle.

questions.question: When is it illegal to drive below the speed limit?
questions.answerA: When driving slowly disrupts the normal flow of traffic
questions.answerB: When in heavy traffic in a construction zone
questions.answerC: Only when driving in rural areas.
questions.answerD: When driving under adverse weather conditions
questions.explanation: It is illegal to drive so slowly that you disrupt the normal flow of traffic. You may receive a citation for driving too slowly.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident and another person is injured. You should:
questions.answerA: Moved the injured away from the scene immediately.
questions.answerB: Always leave the injured where they are.
questions.answerC: Not move the injured unnecessarily. Keep the injured warm and administer first aid.
questions.explanation: After an accident, do not move the injured unnecessarily. Unskilled handling can make serious injuries out of minor ones. Keep the injured warm until skilled help arrives. If there is severe bleeding, attempt to stop the flow of blood with direct pressure.

questions.question: If you are turning onto a street with more than one lane traveling in your direction, you should:
questions.answerA: Turn into the lane closest to your previous lane.
questions.answerB: Turn into the lane marked with an arrow.
questions.answerC: Turn into the middle lane.
questions.explanation: When turning onto a street with more than one lane moving in the direction that you are traveling, turn into the lane that is closest to your previous lane. Do not change lanes when turning.

questions.question: Seat belts are most effective when they are worn by:
questions.answerA: The person driving the car.
questions.answerB: Passengers when they are on a long drive.
questions.answerC: All occupants of a car being driven on an expressway.
questions.answerD: All occupants of a car every time the car is driven.
questions.explanation: When you drive, make sure each person in your vehicle wears a seat belt. In the event of a crash, a person without a seat belt becomes a flying object and a danger to each person in the vehicle.

questions.question: This sign shows one type of:
questions.answerA: Right turn.
questions.answerB: Intersection.
questions.answerC: Lane change.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a T intersection is ahead.

questions.question: This sign indicates that:
questions.answerA: There is a steep hill ahead.
questions.answerB: No trucks are allowed on an upcoming hill.
questions.answerC: A logging road is ahead.
questions.answerD: There are trucks on an upcoming hill.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that there is a steep hill or downgrade ahead.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Sharp right turn.
questions.answerB: A road joins from the right.
questions.answerC: The road ahead turns sharply right, then sharply left.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road ahead turns sharply to the right and then sharply to the left.

questions.question: Emergency vehicles:
questions.answerA: Have the right-of-way when using sirens, horns, and/or flashing lights.
questions.answerB: May use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
questions.answerC: May follow each other.
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to police cars, fire engines, ambulances, or any other emergency vehicles using a siren or air horn and a red or blue flashing light. Follow any instructions given over the emergency vehicles' loudspeakers. Emergency vehicles often follow each other so you should proceed only when you are certain the way is clear.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: Keep right.
questions.answerB: Keep left.
questions.answerC: Pass with caution.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that a divided highway begins ahead. The road splits into two one-way roadways separated by a median or divider. You must keep to the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No U-turn.
questions.answerB: No left turn.
questions.answerC: No right turn.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are prohibited. Do not make a right turn at an intersection where this sign is posted.

questions.question: Which of the following are used on some highways to direct drivers into the proper lanes for turning?
questions.answerA: Flashing red lights
questions.answerB: Flashing yellow lights
questions.answerC: White lines on the side of the road
questions.answerD: White arrows in the middle of the lanes
questions.explanation: Arrows may be used to indicate which lanes should be used for specific purposes, such as driving straight or making a turn.

questions.question: If you need to slow down while driving on a slippery road, the first thing you should do is:
questions.answerA: Firmly apply your brakes.
questions.answerB: Take your foot off the gas pedal.
questions.answerC: Apply your parking brake.
questions.explanation: To slow down on a slippery road, you should first take your foot off the gas pedal. If you need to slow down even more, gently apply a slow, steady pressure to your brake pedal.

questions.question: If you are ordered to install an ignition interlock device in your vehicle, the costs of installation and the monthly inspection must be paid by:
questions.answerA: The court clerk.
questions.answerB: The police officer.
questions.answerC: You.
questions.explanation: An ignition interlock device (IID) is a mechanical unit that is connected to the vehicle’s ignition, horn, and headlights and measures the concentration of alcohol in a person’s breath. If you have more than one alcohol-related contact showing on your driver record, you must have an IID installed on any vehicle you operate before your driving privileges can be reinstated. You must pay for having the device installed and for having it serviced every month.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: No right turn.
questions.answerB: You must turn right.
questions.answerC: Watch for traffic on your right.
questions.answerD: Don’t park on the right side of the street.
questions.explanation: A sign with a red circle and slash over a symbol indicates that the action represented by the symbol (in this example, a right turn) is not allowed.

questions.question: Is it legal cross a double solid yellow centerline to pass?
questions.answerA: Yes.
questions.answerB: No.
questions.answerC: If there is no oncoming traffic.
questions.answerD: If the vehicle ahead of you is driving under the speed limit.
questions.explanation: Two solid yellow lines down the center of a two-way road mean that neither lane of traffic may cross the lines, unless they are turning off of the roadway. A driver can cross double yellow lines when turning into or out of a driveway or entrance to a business. No passing is allowed over a solid yellow line.

questions.question: When approaching a flashing yellow light, drivers should:
questions.answerA: Increase their speed.
questions.answerB: Come to a complete stop.
questions.answerC: Turn on their headlights.
questions.answerD: Slow down and proceed with caution.
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light warns of a hazard. Slow down and proceed with caution.

questions.question: When entering a highway from an entrance ramp, you should generally:
questions.answerA: Enter above the speed of traffic to get ahead.
questions.answerB: Enter slowly to avoid other vehicles.
questions.answerC: Stop first, then slowly enter traffic.
questions.answerD: Accelerate to the speed of traffic.
questions.explanation: Entrance ramps for highways often have acceleration lanes. When merging with traffic from an acceleration lane, you should put your signal on, look for an opening in traffic, accelerate up to the speed of traffic, and merge into an opening in traffic.

questions.question: At a school crossing sign, you should:
questions.answerA: Always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
questions.answerB: Watch for children and be ready to stop.
questions.answerC: Always sound your horn when you see children.
questions.answerD: Be ready to help children crossing the street.
questions.explanation: You must always yield to pedestrians who are in or about to enter a crosswalk. Be alert to pedestrians when driving across intersections or turning.

questions.question: Round signs indicate:
questions.answerA: No passing zones.
questions.answerB: School zones.
questions.answerC: Upcoming railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: Round signs warn drivers of an upcoming railroad crossing area. Drivers should use extra caution when approaching a railroad crossing.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: You must turn left or right.
questions.answerB: You are approaching a T intersection.
questions.answerC: The road that you are on intersects with a divided highway.
questions.answerD: You are on an overpass above a divided highway.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that the road that you are on intersects with a divided highway. A divided highway is two one-way roadways separated by a median or guide rail.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: T intersection.
questions.answerB: Lane shifting.
questions.answerC: Side road.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign warns drivers that they are approaching a T intersection and should prepare to turn either right or left.

questions.question: A red flashing traffic light has the same meaning as a:
questions.answerA: Solid red light.
questions.answerB: Stop sign.
questions.answerC: Yield sign.
questions.explanation: A red flashing traffic signal has the same meaning as a stop sign. When approaching a red flashing signal, come to a complete stop and proceed when it is safe to do so. A stop sign may sometimes also be posted where this signal is located.

questions.question: It is best to keep a space cushion:
questions.answerA: Only in back of your vehicle.
questions.answerB: Only on the left and right sides of your vehicle.
questions.answerC: Only in front of the vehicle.
questions.answerD: On all sides of the vehicle.
questions.explanation: To ensure that you will have time to react to hazards on the roadway, it is best to keep a cushion of space on all sides of your vehicle. Do not crowd vehicles to your left and right sides.

questions.question: If your turn signals fail, you should use ____ to indicate that you are turning.
questions.answerA: Your horn
questions.answerB: Your headlights
questions.answerC: Hand signals
questions.explanation: If your vehicle's turn signals do not work, you should use hand signals to indicate when you intend to change direction.

questions.question: If you are convicted of Driving While Intoxicated (DWI) for the first time, you will:
questions.answerA: Lose your license for 90 days.
questions.answerB: Be fined $50.
questions.answerC: Be required to install an Ignition Interlock Device (IID).
questions.explanation: When convicted of a DWI, a driver who is above the age of 21 faces both administrative and court-convicted consequences. A first-time conviction will result in an administrative license suspension for 90 days. A court conviction could result in a six-month jail sentence and a $500 fine. Penalties increase with subsequent offenses.

questions.question: Drivers who have consumed alcohol before getting behind the wheel:
questions.answerA: Are always aware of the risks they are taking.
questions.answerB: Do not have sufficient control over their bodies and minds or the vehicles being driven.
questions.answerC: Are better drivers because they are more careful than sober drivers.
questions.explanation: Alcohol is a depressant that negatively affects judgment, vision, concentration, understanding of reality, and reaction time. It is never safe to consume alcohol in any amount before getting behind the wheel of a car.

questions.question: What happens if you drink alcohol while taking prescription or over-the-counter medicine?
questions.answerA: The medicine reduces the effect of the alcohol.
questions.answerB: The alcohol will help the medicine cure a cold.
questions.answerC: The combination could multiply the effects of the alcohol or medicine.
questions.answerD: There is no effect because they are different substances.
questions.explanation: Consuming alcohol and other drugs together can increase the impairing effects of both. For example, having one drink while you are also using a cold remedy could affect you as much as several drinks would when being consumed separately from any medications.

questions.question: When driving under icy or snowy conditions, which driving technique will help drivers avoid crashes?
questions.answerA: Add extra weight to their vehicles to improve traction.
questions.answerB: Get off the highways as quickly as possible.
questions.answerC: Engage the four-wheel drive on their vehicles.
questions.answerD: Reduce their speed and increase their following distance.
questions.explanation: Reduce your speed when roads are snow-covered or icy. Doing this and increasing your following distance are the most important techniques for avoiding crashes under snowy or icy conditions.

questions.question: For a driver with an intermediate license, driving restrictions include:
questions.answerA: That a seat belt must be worn by the driver.
questions.answerB: That seat belts must be worn by all passengers.
questions.answerC: A curfew between 1:00 a.m and 5:00 a.m.
questions.explanation: Young drivers with an intermediate license may not drive alone between 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m., except to and from a school activity or job, or in an emergency. Seat belts must be worn by the driver and all passengers.

questions.question: This road sign means:
questions.answerA: A steep grade is ahead.
questions.answerB: You must turn left ahead.
questions.answerC: Do not enter.
questions.explanation: This signs warns that a four-way intersection is ahead.

questions.question: Which of the following statements is true?
questions.answerA: A sudden change in weather calls for a change in driving.
questions.answerB: You should slow down when driving in rain and fog.
questions.answerC: Be particularly aware of vehicles coming up behind you in inclement weather.
questions.explanation: If the weather changes suddenly, you will need to adjust your driving to adapt. Always slow down when driving in rainy or foggy conditions. Be especially aware of vehicles behind you that may be going too fast for conditions.

questions.question: When two vehicles enter an intersection from different highways at the same time, which vehicle must yield the right-of-way?
questions.answerA: Either one
questions.answerB: The vehicle on the left
questions.answerC: The vehicle on the right
questions.explanation: At intersections that are controlled by signs or signals and at intersections that are uncontrolled, the driver on the left must yield the right-of-way to the driver on the right when two vehicles arrive to the intersection at the same time.

questions.question: You are involved in an accident. You should:
questions.answerA: Stop immediately.
questions.answerB: Help the injured.
questions.answerC: Call the police.
questions.explanation: If involved in an accident, you should stop your vehicle immediately. If possible, move the vehicle out of the way of traffic. Call the nearest police agency and ask for an ambulance, if necessary. Do not move the injured unnecessarily, but attempt to stop severe bleeding with direct pressure. Wait for emergency vehicles to arrive.

questions.question: A bicyclist who doesn’t obey traffic laws:
questions.answerA: Is in the right because bicyclists don’t have to obey traffic laws.
questions.answerB: Can be ticketed.
questions.answerC: Will always receive a warning from law enforcement.
questions.explanation: All bicyclists have the same rights, duties, and responsibilities as drivers of motor vehicles. Motorists and bicyclists who do not obey traffic laws can be ticketed.

questions.question: Passing is prohibited:
questions.answerA: On hills and curves.
questions.answerB: At intersections.
questions.answerC: At railroad crossings.
questions.explanation: Locations where it is unlawful and unsafe to pass another vehicle include hills, curves, intersections, and railroad crossings.

questions.question: As you near an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. Your best action is to:
questions.answerA: Speed up to beat the red light.
questions.answerB: Apply the brakes sharply to stop.
questions.answerC: Be prepared to stop in the center of the intersection.
questions.answerD: Be prepared to stop before the intersection.
questions.explanation: A steady yellow traffic light indicates that the light will soon change to red. You should be prepared to stop for the red light, if it is safe to do so.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Highway changes ahead and to the right.
questions.answerB: Hiking trails ahead and to the right.
questions.answerC: Hotel ahead and to the right.
questions.answerD: Hospital ahead and to the right.
questions.explanation: This sign indicates that hospital emergency services are located to the right.

questions.question: A good rule to remember for passing is:
questions.answerA: Pass on the right whenever possible.
questions.answerB: Drive with the flow of traffic and pass only as needed.
questions.answerC: Try to get to the front of any slow-moving traffic so that you can see better.
questions.answerD: Always flash your lights and sound your horn to alert other drivers to your intentions.
questions.explanation: Each time you pass another vehicle, there is an increased chance for a collision. If you are moving faster than surrounding traffic, you will have to continue passing others. Drive with the flow of traffic, within the legal speed limit, and pass only as needed.

questions.question: A “No right on red” sign means:
questions.answerA: Even if the traffic signal is red, you may turn right.
questions.answerB: If the traffic signal is red, you cannot turn right.
questions.answerC: The intersection has a high number of traffic crashes.
questions.answerD: Even if the traffic signal is red, you do not have to come to a stop.
questions.explanation: After coming to a complete stop, you may often turn right on a red light if the way is clear of pedestrians and traffic. However, you must not turn right on a red light when a “No right on red” sign is also posted.

questions.question: Guide signs are ____ signs that provide directional and mileage information to drivers.
questions.answerA: Yellow
questions.answerB: Red
questions.answerC: Green
questions.explanation: Guide signs, sometimes known as destination signs, have a green background and provide directional and mileage information to specific destinations. They can be a helpful resource when driving in unfamiliar locations.

questions.question: While driving, your wheels slip off the edge of the road. You should:
questions.answerA: Jerk the steering wheel to force the vehicle back onto the pavement.
questions.answerB: Speed up and steer back onto the pavement gradually.
questions.answerC: Slam on your brakes and stop.
questions.answerD: Slow down by gently using the brakes. Turn the steering wheel to return to the pavement at a safe speed.
questions.explanation: If your vehicle begins to leave the road, continue to drive with the wheels off the pavement and reduce your speed by gently applying the brakes. When at a safe speed, turn the steering wheel to return to the pavement. Do not attempt to force your vehicle back onto the pavement by sharply turning the steering wheel.

questions.question: When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
questions.answerA: On the main road, just before the exit lane.
questions.answerB: Once you see a toll booth.
questions.answerC: Once you have moved into the exit lane.
questions.answerD: When you first see the exit sign.
questions.explanation: When exiting a highway, you should get into the exit lane well in advance. Do not begin to slow down until after you have moved into the exit lane.

questions.question: From top to bottom, the following is the proper order for traffic lights:
questions.answerA: Red, yellow, green.
questions.answerB: Red, green, yellow.
questions.answerC: Green, red, yellow.
questions.explanation: On a traffic signal arranged vertically, red is always on top and green on the bottom. When arranged horizontally, red is always on the left and green on the right.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Emergency vehicles ahead.
questions.answerB: Uncontrolled intersection ahead.
questions.answerC: Four-way stop ahead.
questions.explanation: This sign warns that a traffic signal is ahead.

questions.question: This sign means:
questions.answerA: Crossroad ahead.
questions.answerB: Flagger ahead.
questions.answerC: Lane ends.
questions.explanation: Warning signs prepare drivers for upcoming road conditions and hazards and are usually yellow with black markings. This sign alerts drivers to an upcoming intersection.

questions.question: A driver should be extra alert to motorcyclists, bicyclists, and pedestrians because:
questions.answerA: They’re difficult to see in traffic.
questions.answerB: They obey different traffic laws than larger motor vehicles.
questions.answerC: They always have the right-of-way.
questions.explanation: In many collisions with motorcycles, bicycles, and pedestrians, drivers reported that they were looking but still did not see the smaller vehicle or pedestrian. These can be more difficult to spot in traffic than passenger vehicles because they are smaller, may move faster, and have less noticeable lighting. To prevent collisions with these smaller and less protected road users, drivers should always be alert to the presence of motorcycles, bikes, and pedestrians.

questions.question: While backing, you should:
questions.answerA: Rely only on your mirrors.
questions.answerB: Flash your lights.
questions.answerC: Open your door to see if it is safe to proceed.
questions.answerD: Turn your head and look through the rear window.
